thread.title: NASA Launches New Site Showing Off Earth
thread.title_full: NASA Launches New Site Showing Off Earth

title: NASA Launches New Site Showing Off Earth
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
20 Oct 2015 07:03 AM EST 
NASA has launched a new website for those on Earth to see the planet's sunlit side every day. With images taken one million miles away, the new site which the space agency started on Monday will give the public a new perspective to glimpse the world from. Using the Deep Space Climate Observatory, the site will host about a dozen new images a day taken over 12 to 36 hours earlier. The spacecraft carries two observation instruments keeping a long-term eye on global changes in vegetation, the ozone layer, and cloud height. The Earth Polychromatic Imaging Camera will also be used each day to develop a sequence of images showing the planet as it rotates. An archive will a search feature will also be made available.
